The edition you are currently reading is the [color=#c0392b][b]200th full edition[/b][/color]. To read any older editions of HF News, please go [url=http://goo.gl/pxojJ]here[/url]. 

[align=center][IMG]http://i.imgur.com/79rvoqQ.png[/IMG][/align]

[b][color=white]HF News Celebrates 200 Editions[/color][/b]
HF News has now reached 200 editions. It was all started by the user [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=74244][color=#99FF00][b]Yin[/b][/color][/url] back on May 16th, 2010. The very first edition of the HF News can be found [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=423656]here[/url]. The sub-forum for it was created about a month later. Currently the project is overseen by [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=515249][color=#EFEFEF][b]Sir[/b][/color][/url], who has led the HF News for over two years now. For this edition, and those that will follow, we have increased the size of the news team as well as introduced new sections to the HF News. If you're interested in joining the HF News team apply [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4310325]here[/url] or if you have something you'd like to report to the news team post [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4205376]here[/url].

[b][color=white]Sales Tags Coming To The Marketplace Soon[/color][/b]
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] has recently announced that [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4300998]Sales Tags[/url] will soon be up for sale in the marketplace. You can see an example image [url=http://hackforums.net:8080/tag-preview.png]here[/url]. The price range is estimated to be between $1-$5 USD in Omnicoin, with that being the only accepted method of payment. This has caused very mixed responses, many marketers like the idea for their sales threads, however also state that with such a low price it will easily become so over used that it won't have the same appeal and will not stand out as much. Only time will tell how it turns out as it may take some time before this is implemented into the marketplace.

[b][color=white]Omnicoin Price Hike[/color][/b]
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] has recently increased the price for the Omnicoin award for a second time, which has also been done with the [url=https://twitter.com/HackForumsNet/status/477554565378605056]LTC award recently[/url]. The current price is now set at 5,000 Omnicoin. You can read the announcement [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4303686]here[/url]. [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] stated this is a move to push the use of AllCrypt for Omnicoin exchanges more to drive up the value of Omnicoin rather than using HF exchangers. If you are interested in purchasing the Omnicoin award, click [url=http://hackforums.net/cryptocoin.php]here[/url].

[b][color=white]Soon To Be Official Group - Phoenix[/color][/b]
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=651337][color=#00BFFF][b]Tibit[/b][/color][/url] prepares to launch his new group Phoenix by getting a logo and other graphics done. Phoenix will be replacing 143 but the focus will continue to be the same which is focusing on the personal life and helping people around on the site. You can go and see what members have been making for Pheonix by clicking [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4291035]here[/url]. Great entries have been made and are continuing to flood in, the graphics that are chosen by [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=651337][color=#00BFFF][b]Tibit[/b][/color][/url] will not only have the honor of representing the group but will also receive a cash award.

[b][color=white]Nexus Returns to its Roots[/color][/b]
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=863752]Hexicidal[/url] opened up a yearly feedback thread (located [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4273637]here[/url]) the other day revealing the new direction of the group. He stated, "I will be reverting Nexus into a Logic/Void lookalike soon, if I could just find a competent and willing graphics artist that would be lovely." which isn't a surprise if you've been up to date on the groups current 'drama'. With this aside, I hope to see the philosophical and SRPP based group we all knew and loved just short of a year ago back in full force.

[b][color=white]Student Recruitment | Enterprise[/color][/b]
After a magnificent launch of the new group Enterprise. [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1301396]Astral[/url] posts a recruitment thread which only four members will be chosen as students for the group. The four students will be mentored on how to earn more cash and will be taught methods only known by a few. If chosen, the student is to pay $50 BTC to ~HF~ and if impressed by [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1301396]Astral[/url]  and [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1042439]~HF~[/url], the student is made a full term member in Enterprise. You can read more and apply for Enterprise by clicking [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4305356]here[/url].

[b][color=white]Deliberate Omnicoin Price Manipulation[/color][/b]
The recent Omnicoin price spiral isn't entirely natural. After some research by Omniscient, it was discovered that someone was deliberately placing sell orders that were well below the market price, driving the price into the ground. However, this realization has drawn incredible support from the community, with some members attempting to buy out this malicious party. However, despite these efforts, the price remains low. It's important for users to go to [b][url=https://www.allcrypt.com/market?id=672]AllCrypt[/url][/b], and use that market instead of making private deals on HF. If you don't have BTC, get BTC, and go to AllCrypt, and help revitalize the OMC economy. 

[b][color=white]Omnicoin Award Price Jumps to 5,000[/color][/b]
Following the downward price spiral, Omniscient raised the price of the Omnicoin award to 5,000, keeping the price approximately constant at $25 USD, and causing a few users to grumble about having to buy more OMC.

[color=deepskyblue][size=x-large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1108450]Baghead[/url][/font][/size][spoiler=]

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color]  Welcome to the 200th edition of the HF News! This time we're joined with Baghead. How are you doin'? Any shoutouts before we continue?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1108450]Baghead[/url]:[/b][/color] Aye clique. Shoutout to baghead.

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color] Aye, baghead. So being a member who has seen the forum's groups evolve over the past couple years, what's your opinion on the groups that are on the forum currently?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1108450]Baghead[/url]:[/b][/color] I joined a while before Omni started to charge for groups. They were pretty cool back then. Most of the groups on the forum today are a financial investment - buy a group, charge members to join, and then sell the group for a higher price. Most of them suck, but there are a few good ones.

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color] Agreed. Since you've pretty much an oldfag in the writers -- what do you think of the changes/expansion that went on?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1108450]Baghead[/url]:[/b][/color] It's getting there. The expansion is great - new infrastructure and better organization. There are a lot of new writers, and as you know it was pretty difficult for us to recruit throughout the past week or two. Over time I'm sure we'll figure it out and replace some of the grammatically weaker writers, but for now we're doing what we can with what we have. When I first joined in 2012, the news team probably consisted of ten to twelve writers. Now we're creeping up on fifty, and the news itself has tripled in size. There are new journalists, reserved backup writers, multiple proofreaders, and even a podcast (which you should go listen to by the way).

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color] Speaking of the podcasts -- How will those work? Will it be a special one time thing, or will you expect to see one of them in each news edition?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1108450]Baghead[/url]:[/b][/color] I'm planning on hosting it weekly, with regular writers that participate every installment or two. We'll also be bringing in guest hosts who can elaborate on relevant topics. The current episode is a little rough as it's our first one, but hopefully it's entertaining in that aspect. You better join in sometime!

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color] Will do, for sure! When you're not browsing HF or playing around on PS, what are you doing?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1108450]Baghead[/url]:[/b][/color] Hanging out with friends, playing soccer or lacrosse, jammin' on the drums, sleeping, or drawing.

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color]  Since, I'm pretty sure that you're finished with school for the year -- what do you already have planned? I remember you talking about going to see some family soon.
[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php=action=profile&uid=1108450]Baghead[/url]:[/b] Yea I'm actually out of town right now, but lately I've just been chillin with friends and working

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color] That's pree' cool. Any of your friends that you know in real life use HF, or heard about the site?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1108450]Baghead[/url]:[/b][/color] Nah, not really. Apart from Tristan (anxtrist) who introduced me to the site in 2011, none of my friends know what HF is.

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color] Do you like the direction that HF has taken since you signed up all the way back in 2011?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1108450]Baghead[/url]:[/b][/color] I think it would be cooler if HF went east, right now we're headed towards southern Indonesia. But HF has been going the same direction the whole time, the path just happens to lead to southern Indonesia and possibly Uzbekistan.

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color] I feel you. What's one of the things that keeps you coming back to HF?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1108450]Baghead[/url]:[/b][/color] There are a few people that keep me on HF, and they're the only reason. Mostly just to mess around. It's also where the fbn subforum is.

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color] who care?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1108450]Baghead[/url]:[/b][/color] sometimes i wonder but then i dont
[/spoiler]

[color=deepskyblue][size=x-large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=580684]RDCA[/url][/font][/size][spoiler=]

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1653635][b][color=#DDA0DD]Clark:[/color][/b][/url] Welcome to this weeks edition of the HF News. Today I'm here with HF member RDCA. How's it going RD? Do you have any shotouts you'd like to make?
[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=580684]RDCA:[/url] [/b]Eh, shout out to my MRT family and you Writ3r peoples. TH and Para <3

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1653635][b][color=#DDA0DD]Clark:[/color][/b][/url] Lets address the elephant in the room (I'm not talking about your mother for once). You're now a staff member, and rightly so. You have a very good understanding of the rules on HF. Where did you acquire all of this knowledge? (From my HF Rules quiz perhaps?)
[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=580684]RDCA:[/url][/b] Yes, I would say correcting your so called 'rules quiz' was a help. Though, all the knowledge stems from the Help Docs and the RANF section. Overall helping members with site issues and technical issues is a great way to learn.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1653635][b][color=#DDA0DD]Clark:[/color][/b][/url] I'm glad I could be of some assistance. I know you've only been staff for a short time, but how has the experience been so far?
[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=580684]RDCA:[/url][/b] It definitely is a lot of work, but I'm glad I took it. A lot of the more senior Staff members were extremely helpful the first week or two and definitely showed me the ropes. I think I am learning fast and doing well, but only time will tell. People need to realize Staff isn't there to ban everyone and make their time here bad; we're here to enforce rules and keep as many people's experience on HF as positive as possible. Also, warnings aren't the end of the world, they exist as a reminder to follow the rules.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1653635][b][color=#DDA0DD]Clark:[/color][/b][/url] Has becoming staff taken up a lot of your time or do you find that things are relatively the same?
[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=580684]RDCA:[/url][/b] It takes a bit of time, especially to adjust to the workload. Though, once you're a bit used to reports and develop your own style and system Hack Forums returns to how it used to be, with slightly different responsibilities. I just have less time to patrol the RANF section, but I still do MRT related things and Writ3rs stuff. Being Staff obviously don't consume my life.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1653635][b][color=#DDA0DD]Clark:[/color][/b][/url] Well you'd have to have a life to begin with.. You've been on HF for sometime now; what keeps you coming back?
[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=580684]RDCA:[/url][/b] Well, my future is almost undoubtedly going to be in security and computers. I also have a lot of friends here, some of whom are extremely smart. Thinking about it, shout out to all of Null. They're an extremely smart group of people.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1653635][b][color=#DDA0DD]Clark:[/color][/b][/url] What would your ideal career be and why?
[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=580684]RDCA:[/url][/b] I'm planning/majoring in Computer Science, though I'm considering a double major with Risk Analysis. My ideal job is owning a giant computer firm, either in security or big enough to have a multifaceted company where security is apart of us.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1653635][b][color=#DDA0DD]Clark:[/color][/b][/url] What's one thing you'd change to better HF?
[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=580684]RDCA:[/url] [/b]There are a few things, but they are all with due time. Omniscient is always planning and working. There are very few ideas which he hasn't already thought of himself. If I could just magically change one thing, it would either be fixing the search system, or account security. Those are two very important things which I'm sure Omniscient will conquer one day.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1653635][b][color=#DDA0DD]Clark:[/color][/b][/url] What makes you so special?
[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=580684]RDCA:[/url] [/b]Yes.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1653635][b][color=#DDA0DD]Clark:[/color][/b][/url] What advice would you give for those looking to become staff?
[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=580684]RDCA:[/url][/b] I haven't really been here long enough, but dedication pulls through. A lot of people try too hard though, there needs to be balance. You shouldn't be ruining your real life in exchange for an online one. If you can't balance that how can you ever balance the demands of Staff? Overall, the job just isn't for everyone. Just be yourself with an additional bit of kindness and helpfulness. Remember, it is a volunteer position on an online forum, there is no need to make enemies or be bitter. Sure, you can be passionate and angry, but there are limits.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1653635][b][color=#DDA0DD]Clark:[/color][/b][/url] Why do frequently give out warnings to people who don't deserve them?
[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=580684]RDCA:[/url][/b] I'm warning you for nonsense now.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1653635][b][color=#DDA0DD]Clark:[/color][/b][/url] I'm looking forward to it. Thanks again for joining us RDCA, you've provided us with some wise insight. Any last words before I ban you for disallowed blackhat activity?
[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=580684]RDCA:[/url][/b] who care.
[/spoiler]

[color=deepskyblue][size=x-large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2084253]Bobby Orr[/url][/font][/size][spoiler=]

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] Welcome to 200th edition of the HF News, today we're here with Bobby Orr. Any shout-outs you'd like to make before we begin?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2084253][color=white][b]Bobby Orr:[/b][/color][/url] Hey 630! I'd just like to give a shout-out to all my old friends from Void!

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] I was going to ask you about void a little later, but I guess we can jump into that now. How did you like void? Are you still active in SRPP?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2084253][color=white][b]Bobby Orr:[/b][/color][/url] I loved Void, I thought it was the only HQ group on Hack Forums. Everything else is either hacking, gaming, or money making. I was so sad to see it go. As for SRPP, I spend most of my time there. 831 of my total posts are there as well. It can either be the highest of quality sections, or the absolute lowest of quality when the trolls come in.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] How do you feel about the recent rule that non-upgraded members cannot post and that mentors cannot touch the posts there? Has it improved the section at all?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2084253][color=white][b]Bobby Orr:[/b][/color][/url] Its a catch 22 rule. On one hand, it did eliminate some trolls, but there were some HQ non upgraded members. On the other hand, many l33ts/ub3rs still troll there constantly, and the mentors can do nothing about it. So I would say, it did not make a difference.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] That's kind of a bummer to hear then. I see you survived the change from Void to Nexus, how's that working out for you?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2084253][color=white][b]Bobby Orr:[/b][/color][/url] Not that well. I really dislike LoL, but the only reason I'm still in there is due to the fact that some of my old friends are in there. I'm thinking about leaving Nexus later tonight.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] Well that's no good. Are there any other HF groups you have your sights set on?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2084253][color=white][b]Bobby Orr:[/b][/color][/url] Honestly, just The Empire and Polymath. Everything else (in my eyes) seems low quality, with the exemption of FBN.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] I'm not gonna weigh into groups too much, but they seem alright. There's a whole mystery factor with Polymath that bugs me. So how did you end up finding Hack Forums?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2084253][color=white][b]Bobby Orr:[/b][/color][/url] I ended up finding Hack Forums while searching for a minecraft client. I found it, and just fell in love with the site. I found the SRPP section and just got addicted to it.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] Do you still play Minecraft at all or any other games for that matter?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2084253][color=white][b]Bobby Orr:[/b][/color][/url] Yes. I play Minecraft and Rust a lot at the moment. I'm saving up for a gaming PC, so until then, anything that works on Mac I'll have to play. I'm trying to get bootcamp set for it, but it seems it won't work.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] What servers do you play on? I was obsessed with Hacker Craft, but quit after the shutdown.
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2084253][color=white][b]Bobby Orr:[/b][/color][/url] Mainly on Shotbow, I play a lot of the Wasted game mode. Other than Shotbow, I play on Wynncraft, which is like a RPG server, no PvP. As for modded servers, I play Attack of the B team servers a lot. Great modpack.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] So what do you do outside of the forum?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2084253][color=white][b]Bobby Orr:[/b][/color][/url] I play a lot of Airsoft. I really got into it recently, I'm waiting on the delivery of a few more guns and some accessories. Other that, street and ice hockey. Looking for new hobbies as well.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] Nice! I love playing hockey. So how you rate your overall Hack Forums experience on a scale of 1-10.
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2084253][color=white][b]Bobby Orr:[/b][/color][/url] I would rate it around a 8.5/10. I really love it here!

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] If you could change one thing about the site what would it be?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2084253][color=white][b]Bobby Orr:[/b][/color][/url] Oh jeez. Only one thing? I'd have to say I would get rid of the eBook Bazaar and ban the sale of any type of eBook that does not meet extremely strict guidelines.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] I'd have to agree I'm not a fan of eBooks. Well that's all the time we have for this interview. Would you like to make any concluding remarks before we wrap up this interview?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2084253][color=white][b]Bobby Orr:[/b][/color][/url] Well, thanks for interviewing me, and I can't wait to read this next edition! And I love your signature man!
[/spoiler]

[color=deepskyblue][size=x-large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=720138]Predator[/url][/font][/size][spoiler=]
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] Welcome to the 200th edition of the HF News, today we're here with Predator. Any shout-outs you'd like to make before we begin?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=720138][color=#EFEFEF][b]Predator:[/b][/color][/url] Yeah, I'll give a huge Shout-Out to [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=651337]Tibit[/url], the noobiest hacker of them all!

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] I agree. You are quite active in his group, The Empire. What has your experience been like during your time in the group?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=720138][color=#EFEFEF][b]Predator:[/b][/color][/url] I've been in The Empire since about 2-3 weeks after the group was created, so I'm one of the oldest members there... Overall it has been an extremely positive experience. There have been ups and downs, but it's a great group.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] The [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=1860595]first thread[/url] in your post history is from October 2011 but you joined HF in March 2011. How did it take you more than six months to post your first thread?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=720138][color=#EFEFEF][b]Predator:[/b][/color][/url] I had joined and registered then forgot about the site. When I came back and tried to register my e-mail was already registered so I just recovered my account. I registered when I was first starting to experiment with 'hacking' but at the time I was registering on a million sites and never really logged back on to any of them. For some reason I came back to HF, and well... Here I am.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] What sort of hacking activities have you been involved in and have you used HF to your advantage and learned anything?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=720138][color=#EFEFEF][b]Predator:[/b][/color][/url] The extent of my 'hacking' was pretty much rats and keyloggers. I did it because I could and I thought it was cool that I was able to do it. After awhile though I just got bored with it. I never got involved with anything highly illegal (fraud, etc.) and never desired to. I did, however, take my knowledge from HF to build my IT skillset. I'll actually be attending a national web-design competition next week.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] I see you have been posting in the newest sub-forum here on HF, [url=http://hackforums.net/forumdisplay.php?fid=318]Vices[/url]. How do you feel about this new section on the site?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=720138][color=#EFEFEF][b]Predator:[/b][/color][/url] Vices came as a surprise to me. Omni had said multiple times he would not make a drug sub-forum. I think it's a good addition to the site as it gets all of the weed threads out of the lounge and gives people a place to talk about that sort of thing. I think if it's heavily moderated and posts stay high quality that it'll be a good section.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] I agree and am happy to see the new area as well. Do you have any vices of your own or any thoughts on those who do?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=720138][color=#EFEFEF][b]Predator:[/b][/color][/url] I smoke, (ciggarettes) but that's about it. Personally, I feel that people can do whatever they want to themselves as long as it doesn't hurt others. But some people just let things just go too far.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] You recently posted a [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4253107]thread[/url] ranting about how much the customers at the major retailer you work for really get on your nerves. Do the customers really upset you that much and have you thought about finding a new job?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=720138][color=#EFEFEF][b]Predator:[/b][/color][/url] On a day-to-day basis it isn't that bad as most of the customers are pleasant and easy to work with. That thread just highlighted the worst of the job, without really talking about the good half. I had a good offer at a networking solutions company near me but they weren't able to work with my college schedule. For now I think I'll be sticking with the retailer. I'd also like to highlight this rant above all the others: Yes, it [i]is[/i] a big deal to give you $20 in $1 bills.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] Retail is a tough environment to work in, that's for sure. What's the story on your national web design contest you're going to be competing in next week?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=720138][color=#EFEFEF][b]Predator:[/b][/color][/url] Well, I can't give a whole lot of information due to keeping my identity somewhat private. My team (my friend and I) competed in the FBLA (Future Business Leaders of America, which is a high school organization) web design contest. The contest is based on both the design and the presentation. We did extremely well at the state competition and we're preparing our site and presentation for nationals now. I'd also highly recommend that anyone who is reading this and is still in high school join the FBLA. There are a lot of competitive events relating to computers.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] If everything works out in your favor we could quite possibly see you leaving your cashiering job very soon. How active do you think you'll remain on HF once your career starts going?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=720138][color=#EFEFEF][b]Predator:[/b][/color][/url] My activity has actually lowered quite a bit since around 2012-2013. I don't post much anymore except for in the groups I'm in. I think I'll hang around HF for a few more years to come but I don't know if I'll ever pick back up in activity.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] That seems to happen quite often with a lot of members. Do you have any goals you'd still like to achieve on the forum?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=720138][color=#EFEFEF][b]Predator:[/b][/color][/url] Not necessairly. I'll be hitting 5,000 posts and 500 reputation pretty soon. I'm not a super-user but I think that's a pretty good milestone for me. I'd like to get a rare-award sometime, but we'll see. 

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] Is there anything we did not discuss that you would like to touch upon as we bring this interview to a close?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=720138][color=#EFEFEF][b]Predator:[/b][/color][/url] Not really but thank you for taking the time to interview me for this edition! 200 is a huge milestone and I would like to thank everyone that was and is on the news team for the great work.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] You're welcome. I wish you good luck in your future endeavors and it was nice chatting with you today.
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=720138][color=#EFEFEF][b]Predator:[/b][/color][/url] I'd like to welcome anyone with questions regarding FBLA to send me a [url=http://hackforums.net/private.php?action=send&uid=720138]PM[/url] and I can give you a better explanation and link you to some great resources. Anyway, as my good friend [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=863752]Hexicidal[/url] would say: [i]See you starside[/i].
[/spoiler]
posts.subject: HF News - 200

posts.message:

[align=center][b]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1124063]BoomShot[/url] & [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1173142]Goodies[/url][/b][/align]

[b][color=white]Baseboard Management Controller Hardware Vulnerability[/color][/b]
A recent discovery has brought to light a vulnerability in the Baseboard management controller (BMC) of several motherboards produced by Supermicro. A binary file stores plain text passwords locally. This file can be downloaded easily by connecting via TCP to port 49152. An HTTP GET request with the parameters "GET /PSBlock" to port 49152 will retrieve this document containing remote administrative details which can be used for further access to the router. An estimation of over 31,000 machines are currently vulnerable to this attack. Crafted queries on http://ShodanHQ.com will yield an abundance of vulnerable machines.

[b][color=white]Domino's Pizza and Possible Blackmail[/color][/b]
A group of French hackers allegedly retrieved the database of a Domino's Pizzeria stored on French and Belgian websites. They contacted Domino's asking for £30,000 (roughly 51,000 USD) by Monday, June 16 while threatening to leak the databases comprised which were composed of the phone numbers, addresses, emails, and passwords of 600,000 Domino's members. Domino's refused to play along with the malicious games of the hackers and did not pay them. The hackers did not release the database which they may not have even obtained in the first place.

[i]"Nothing happened. Nothing. Once the franchise learned of the breach, they patched it up and contacted all of their online customers. Because there was no financial data involved, it boiled down to the mere inconvenience of having to change a pizza-ordering password."[/i] - Domino's Spokesman

[b][color=white]Hackers Reverse-Engineer National Security Agency’s Spy Kit[/color][/b]
Due to Edward Snowden's leak of the National Security Agency’s (NSA) Advanced Network Technology catalog, hackers have been steadily working with Software Defined Radios (SDR), among other tools, with the hopes of reverse-engineering numerous tools used by the NSA for spying purposes by capturing, replicating, and dissecting its radio frequencies. A lot of the devices on the catalog can be easily recreated and the parts are readily available with little cost. One of the many devices that can be created is capable of recording and transmitting data from a personal computer. These devices may not be as small as the NSA's, but they’re just as efficient.

[i]"Showing how these devices exploit weaknesses in our systems means we can make them more secure in the future."[/i] - Michael Ossmann

[b][color=white]Over $620,000 in Dogecoin Mined on Hijacked Machines[/color][/b]
Dogecoin, a meme-based Cryptocurrency, was mined on a collection of malware-infected storage devices. The hacker accumulated over $620,000 in two months from mining on these hijacked machines. Tracing the Dogecoins to the hacker was not an easy task. However, Dell's SecureWorks security division was able to gather information on the hacker based on the hacker's username and Github account. As Cryptocurrencies continue to grow and become more prominent, hackers will continue to produce malware to target them.

[i]"To date, this incident is the single most profitable, illegitimate mining operation."[/i] - Pat Litke

[b][color=white]Largest DDoS Attack Ever in the History of the Internet[/color][/b]
The largest Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) attack in the history of the internet hit Hong Kong's democracy voting website with the power of 300+ gigabits per second which completely disabled the website. The hacker used a network of compromised computers to attack the website. Matthew Prince, the co-founder and CEO of CloudFlare, stated that the DDoS attack was "one of the largest and most persistent." Hackers are proving that there's no limit to what they can do.

[b][color=white]Android Ransomware Decrypted by a Student[/color][/b]
Russian hackers have proved themselves to be noteworthy when it comes to blackhat applications, specifically malware. One of the malware masterpieces, SimpLocker, has been targeting Android cellphones located in the United Kingdom, Switzerland, Germany, India, Russia, as well as other countries. SimpLocker's functionality is simple but extremely malevolent; it encrypts one's SD card using an AES algorithm and demands the ransom of 21 USD in order for the victim to be provided with a decryption key to regain access to his/her files. To protect the identities of the men behind the curtain, SimpLocker is using the TOR network for the transmission of data between the attacker and the victim. The data transmitted contain sensitive information such as the cellphone's IMEI, its OS version, and the cellphone manufacturer.

After a static and dynamic analysis of the malicious application's code, a student of Sussex University has found a way to cure an infected device by studying the decryption method of the ransomware. The cure of SimpLocker can be found [url=http://securehoney.net/code/SimplelockerAntidote.java]here[/url]. It's free to use by any person who has fallen a victim to the aforementioned malware.

[b][color=white]NullCrew Hacktivists Arrested by FBI[/color][/b]
A U.S. citizen named Timothy French has been arrested by the FBI for allegedly being involved in cyber attacks that targeted universities, corporations, and government departments. As law enforcement officials have stated, information has been collected regarding a number of universities and companies that have been targeted by NullCrew Hacktivists. After processing the collected information, officials have came to the conclusion that in several attacks, the amount of stolen data was enormous with thousands of credentials being published all throughout the internet. The arrested hacker has been hiding under numerous nicknames such as "Orbit," "crysis," and "c0rps3." To conclude, officials have also mentioned that the aforementioned people have been planning their attacks using online services such as Twitter and Skype.

On the assumption that Timothy French is found guilty of committing computer fraud, he is facing a sentence of 10 years in prison and a fine of $250.000.

[b][color=white]2012 RCE Bug - An Ongoing Exploitation Act[/color][/b]
According to Trend Micro, an IT security company, the RCE bug (which was found back in April 2012) has been named as the most common exploit used when it comes to remote code execution. The exploit has been targeting Windows' common controls and it is known to impact a considerable amount of software. However, it most prominently impacts Microsoft Office. The RCE bug enables the attacker to execute malicious code by using modified Office documents which are spread, in most cases, through e-mail messages. The most common reason for a machine to be exploitable using the RCE bug is the fact that a lot of users tend to leave their computer software non-updated. A security analyst who works for Trend Micro has also reported that exploited machines have a plethora of information stolen. Namely usernames, passwords, network information, system architecture details, and proxy settings.

[b][color=white]Cruise Makes Your Car Driverless[/color][/b]
Everyone knows about Google’s self-driving car, but a startup called Cruise has taken the concept of self-driving cars to a whole new level. If you already have your dream car and want a cure for your laziness, this is for you. Cruise allows you to turn your current car into a self-driving machine. Cruise consists of roof-mounted sensors and a series of actuators that control the pedals and steering mechanisms. The control system is located in the trunk, and to turn on this bad boy you simply press a button installed on the dash. However, Cruise can’t be called a perfect autonomous driving system yet, as currently it is more like an improved cruise control. Currently, the tech is only set to work in the San Francisco Bay area and is only compatible with Audi’s A4s and S4s. The estimated price for this device will be $10,000, and if Cruise keeps on improving the device, it will be well worth it.

[b][color=white]Google Glass Goes On Sale Outside The US[/color][/b]
Google Glass has exploded since its release and it is obvious people want it around the globe. Luckily, Google finally started shipping Google Glass outside of the United States. There have been tons of orders already within the past 24 hours, so there is a chance it will be sold out. Currently only the Explorer Edition is available for purchase outside of the United States, and has a hefty price tag of £1,000. You can choose your own Glass color, and Google throws in a free color change for your frame to make your Google Glass more unique. The most downloaded app currently for the Google Glass overseas is The Guardian newspaper, and there are plenty of other apps being downloaded at this moment specifically for the Google Glass. Here in America, Google is working on improving the performance of the device. So far, Google has added more RAM to the latest Google Glass model and Google is using the feedback from customers to improve their smart eyewear.

[b][color=white]Amazon Announces The Fire Phone[/color][/b]
Amazon has announced their first phone. The Fire is priced at $199 and comes with a unique feature never seen before in other smartphones. The Fire has dynamic perspective, meaning the phone redraws 3D images so you can look underneath icons on the screen. The Fire has four IR cameras that have a large field of view, allowing the dynamic perspective to work flawlessly. The Fire was built for Amazon’s Prime subscribers and Amazon is ensuring personalized support for The Fire. A feature that seems to be the most interesting, however, is Firefly. Firefly is a built-in application that allows the user to purchase items instantly that are found around them. Firefly is definitely going to boost Amazon’s marketing department, and many people can’t wait to use the feature.

While smart watches are a new thing, it seems every company is trying to jump into the world of wearable tech. Motorola is no exception to this. Motorola initially announced the watched quite a bit ago, highlighting the unique, and almost traditional circular design. Recently, the full thing was unveiled at Google I/O, giving visitors a chance to check out the watch as well as try it on. The watch is designed like a classic analog watch, with what seems to be physical hands on the face, which is in-fact a small touch screen. It really does have a classic watch look to it. Everyone is getting into the virtual reality game, now Google joins the others. At Google I/O, they gave out a nondescript cardboard box, and were very vague about what was inside. [b][color=white]Orcs Must Die: Unchained beta date announced[/color][/b]
Robot Entertainment has announce that the closed beta for its forthcoming game which is known as Orcs Must Die: UNCHAINED will commence on June 27th.
Orcs Must Die: Unchained is a fast-paced Fortress Siege action game in which teams of heroes battle head-to-head to attack and defend ancient strongholds. For the first time in the Orcs Must Die! series, teams of players are responsible for both sides of the battle and building traps to stop the enemy assault and summoning their own armies to lead against the enemy defense. The beta of the game starts with a new map and three new heroes, adding to the ten heroes already playable in the alpha. Free-to-play hero rotations will allow players to try out new heroes each weekend from the start of the game beta till early July. Players will also be able to tinker with the new deck-editing system to figure out the best combination of traps and minions to defeat their opponents. Alpha players will be automatically granted access to the beta. If you're a first-time player looking for a chance to get into the beta, you can visit the Orcs Must Die website to register. [color=white][b]Destiny beta heading to Xbox 360 and Xbox One in late July[/b][/color]
According to a new trailer on the Xbox One dashboard, the Destiny beta will be coming to the Xbox 360 and the Xbox One in late July. Gamers can obtain a code for the beta by pre-ordering the game, and have an active subscription to Xbox Live when it goes live. The beta is scheduled to be released on the Play Station 3 and Play Station 4 on July 17, where it will be exclusive for some time before it is released on the Xbox 360 and Xbox One. An alpha test for Destiny was released on the Play Station 4 recently, which gave players a taste of what is to come in the beta and the full game when it is released in September.

[b][color=white]Ridge Racer Driftopia servers is near the end[/color][/b]
Bandai Namco has announced its intention to shut down the servers for Ridge Racer Driftopia the free-to-play racing game has been in beta since September 2013 as a Steam Early Access title and on Play Station 3. Bandai Namco thanked players for their support. "All the feedbacks will be taken into account for the upcoming projects," read a statement. A statement from the publisher, acquired by Eurogamer, thanked players for support and promised: "all the feedbacks will be taken into account for the upcoming projects." It's unclear if the game will live beyond the beta server shutdown. Driftopia was the follow-up to Ridge Racer Unbounded, from developer Bugbear Entertainment. Recent feedback on the game's Steam forum has focused on server connection issues and the game's micro-transaction-heavy business model. Driftopia entered beta in August 2013 before launching as a free-to-play Early Access game in September. A beta for the game is available on PS3 in Europe.

[b][color=white]Two Jailed For Mosque Bacon Attack[/color][/b]
Chelsea Lambie, 18 and Douglas Cruikshank, 39 were both jailed earlier in the week for attacking Edinburgh's central mosque with bacon. The two both attached bacon to the door handles of the mosque and then proceeded to throw bacon strips inside the mosque, the attack happened on January 31st, 2013. Cruikshank pleaded guilty and received a 9-month prison sentence, where-as Lambie initially pleaded she was innocent and has since been found guilty in court with a 12-month prison sentence. Evidence in the proceedings included an internet search for the location for the central mosque and searches for local taxi's and even a Google search for "Edinburgh mosque bacon". A security guard at the mosque described the attack as "very disturbing" and expressed his emotions: "we do not eat pork or even touch it. I felt very bad seeing this meat in my sacred place. "

[b][color=white]Texas Man Told To Remove Flag Due To Threat To Muslims[/color][/b]
As [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4296787]reported[/url] by [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1093501]Roger Waters[/url], a Texan man was told by his apartment complex that he must remove his American flag from his balcony because it was a "threat towards the Muslim community." Duy Tran has friends who have fought and died for America and wanted to show his support by hanging up the flag but soon after he did he was told by the apartment complex manager that he had to remove it. In a statement the manager said “Such guidelines maintain the aesthetics of our apartment community and provide for the safety of all residents,” but in response Tran has said he has no plans to remove the flag: "I’m gonna leave my flag there, as an American, until she shows me proof that I don’t have the right to leave my flag there."

[b][color=white]Berlin House of One: Church-Mosque-Synagogue Under One Roof[/color][/b]
Due to the growing adversity within the state of Berlin, architects have come together to provide a singular place of worship for the Christian, Muslim, and Jewish population. After a design competition was held the winning building included three separate areas of worship and a central meeting place, each area is the same size however holds a different shape designed according to the specifics of each faith. The religious citizens have all been in favor of the building and are looking forward to the central ground where they can participate and interact with one another. In the past different faiths have used the same buildings but not at the same time which is what makes this project unique and so well supported, it has become a symbol of unity and progression. The project is now in its fundraising phase and is taking the next steps to turn blueprints into buildings.

[b][color=white]FIFA Bosses Secretly Double Salaries[/color][/b]
With all the recent controversy regarding the World Cup such as match fixing and bribery, the most recent of them has uncovered that the governing bodies have secretly been doubling their salaries to $200,000 (£118,000). Leaked documents have revealed that the 'Exco', executive committee, has been stuffing their pockets with the previous cup's earnings - it's also been revealed that the president, Sepp Blatter, has been awarding members $4.4m in secret bonuses as well. These allegations have only added fuel to the flame after the controversial decision to award Qatar with the rights to host the 2022 World Cup, as a result the FIFA president has come under even more fire for possibly accepting bribes from Mohamad Bin Hammam, the former football boss for the country. When confronted. FIFA simply stated: "We publish our financial report in line with international financial reporting standards on our website".

[b][color=white]Snowden Receives German Civic Courage Award[/color][/b]
Our favorite whistler-blower has continued to make his way into the headlines, with the most recent submission of being awarded the Fritz Bauer Prize in Germany. The head of the Humanist Union stated in a report that: "Snowden has showed outstanding civic courage by disclosing the practice of shadowing that violates human rights" and "His revelations have reanimated the discussion of the principles of special service activities." Snowden currently resides in Russia after being granted temporary asylum, the US has charged him with espionage and revoked his passport. Last summer he received the Whistleblower Award and in October he received the Sam Adams Award for 'Integrity in Intelligence' during a meeting in Moscow. He is currently seeking a meeting with German officials to testify about American wrongdoings.

[b][color=white]Overstock Promoting Bitcoin with 3% of Profits Made[/color][/b]
According to Patrick Bryne, CEO of Overstock, within the next two decades people will forget that we use any currency other than bitcoins. Overstock began accepting bitcoins earlier this year, and to the surprise of many, profits exceeded $1.6 million in bitcoin related transactions. Last Saturday, Bryne announced that 3% of the bitcoin profits will be donated to organizations that are actively trying to promote bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies. Overstock was the first big company to accept bitcoin (followed by DISH and Expedia), and they even plan on paying their employees bonuses in bitcoin.

[b][color=white]GENERcoin: Green Renewable Energy Backed by Cryptocurrency[/color][/b]
We are all aware of the terrible affects that burning fossil fuels has on our environment; many climatologists agree that we have passed the "point of safe return" in this matter. There is a Canadian company based out of British Columbia that is attempting to solve the problems that burning fossil fuels creates: a truly renewable fuel that does not use food products such as corn. As a way to promote the fuel that this company is creating, they have created a new cryptocurrency that they will use to "pre-sell" the new biofuel. Investors of the company will be allowed to purchase GENERcoins at the exchange and use them to trade for other cryptocurrencies, or to buy the new fuel at a 51% discount to current market prices. The coin was initially selling for $0.062/coin, equivalent to 10,000 BTU (British thermal unit) which included the discounted rate. The coin holders now have the options of either redeeming their coins for the fuel in exchange, or trading them as they see fit.

[b][color=white]BurnerCoin: The New Altcoin Specifically for Motorsports[/color][/b]

[color=white][b]Darkcoin Battles Setback[/b][/color]

The masternodes act as transaction bundlers and mixers, preventing network actors from discerning the origin and destination of transactions among the network. This feature, called DarkSend, incentivizes masternode participation through a dividend-like payment system.

[b][color=white]Bacteria Evade Human Immune System With Bursts of Mutations During Infection[/color][/b]
New research from Penn State reveal bacteria that cause ulcers evade the human immune system with bursts of infection during initial infection. This is the first study to show the interaction between the immune system and invading bacteria in which the bacteria can counter the immune system by evolving quickly. Now that scientists know exactly how the bacteria evades the immune system, they can begin research on medicine to either stop the bacteria from evolving or allow the immune system to discover the bacteria even after it mutates.

[b][color=white]Family Violence Leaves Genetic Imprints on Children[/color][/b]
A new study from the Tulane University School of Medicine found that children in more violent homes are more likely to have their DNA scarred. Researchers found that children in homes of violence, suicide, and incarcerations have significantly shorter telomores. Telomores are a cellular marking for aging. Shorter telomores are often linked to higher risks for heart disease, obesity, cognitive decline, diabetes and mental illness. Researchers got this information by taking genetic samples from 85 children and then interviewing them and their family about home environment and their lifestyles. 

[b][color=white]New Invisibility Cloak prevents objects from being touched[/color][/b]
Ever since Harry Potter has shown off invisibility cloak, scientists have tried to replicate such a cloak to certain senses. In the past, objects were hidden from heat, light, and sound from various invisibility cloaks. Researchers at Karlsruhe Institute of Technology have discovered a certain metamaterial that shields objects from being touched. By surrounding said object in a cavity, the object will be untouchable because of the crystalline material directing the forces of the touching finger away. Although the cloak so far can cover few volumes, KIT researchers are looking for further implementation of this metamaterial on larger objects.

[b][color=white]Menthol Cigarettes Become Popular Among Teenagers[/color][/b]
Recently, young smokers have been attracted toward menthol cigarettes. These menthol cigarettes previously appealed to the younger crowd because of fewer negative externalities, but researchers are the University of Waterloo say that the risk of developing lung cancer is just as prevalent in menthol cigarettes and non-menthol cigarettes. In fact, researchers found that those who smoked menthol cigarettes were 33% more likely to continue smoking. Also, those who smoked menthol cigarettes smoked more than those who didn't, and this is because of the minty flavor in menthol cigarettes. This poses a huge problem for the government and their previous efforts on reducing the nicotine addiction rates among the youth.

[b][color=white]Breakthrough in Ovarian Cancer Treatment[/color][/b]
Doctors from the University of Arizona Cancer Center at St. Joseph's Hospital and Medical Center recently unveiled the usage of trebananib in patients. Trebananib serves a catalyst for growth of blood vessels in cancerous tumors, allowing for faster recuperation time for cancer patients with immature tumors. This allows for tumor shrinkage and slows the rate at which cancerous cells reproduce. Trebananib does not increase the risk of hypertension, which previously was a problem for substances that sought to shrink tumors. Although Ovarian Cancer is still largely fatal, doctors hope to use this research to inhibit tumor growth rates and give patients a longer and less painful lifespan. [/align][/spoiler][/align]

[b][color=white]Bypassing Spinal Cord Injuries[/color][/b]
The days of paralysis brought on by spinal cord injury may soon be over. A new technology known as Neurobridge can learn to decode neural impulses and transmit them to a muscle-stimulating sleeve around the patient's disabled limbs. This implant allows motor communication to reroute itself around the injured area, restoring some brain-muscle coordination. So far the new technology has been tested on only one patient, Ian Burkhart, a 23-year-old quadriplegic from Ohio. The trial showed promising results, and now four more potential patients are scheduled to receive the implant.

[color=white] [b]Test strategy to cure infants for HIV.[/b][/color]
Back in 2013, the announcement of a baby's HIV miraculously getting  cured of HIV hit The New England Journal of Medicine fast, with hopes that other babies could be cured the exact same way. Just after 30 hours of birth, the baby began treatment for HIV, however, the mixture of drugs used on the baby was stopped roughly when the child was 18 months of age. Even after treatment was stopped, the baby's blood plasma showed no sign of the virus. The baby is currently more than three years of age and living a perfectly fine, HIV free life. How the child beat the virus is still a mystery to a handful of doctors.

This is where the US national institute of health comes in. They plan on getting 54 babies, all HIV positive, and do the exact same protocols as on the Mississippi baby, to try and reach the same results. Within the first 48 hours of their birth, they will begin heavy treatment to cure the HIV early on. Doctors wonder, if this success rate is high, could this be the change we have looking for? Could this be the starting point of an HIV free world?  

[color=white] [b]Adults suffering from Asperger Syndrome - Higher suicide rate? [/b]  [/color]
A newly released, British study shows adults who have the milder form of Autism known as Asperger Syndrome are more likely to contemplate suicide than those in the general population. The survey of 374 British adults revealed that 66% reported having suicidal thoughts and 35% have actually planned or attempted suicide. Those with Asperger Syndrome along with depression were FOUR times more likely to think about suicide and twice as likely to plan or attempt suicide, compared to those who do not have any form of depression, at all.

[b][color=white]Mapping Illnesses[/color][/b]
Using DNA and protein mapping combined with 15 years worth of health records from over 6 million Danes, researchers have attempted to map the progression of multiple diseases across an entire population. The map shows strong correlations between diseases that were once thought to be unrelated, such as gout and cardiovascular disease. The goal is to develop a list of trends which will allow medical professionals to forecast an individual's health and make it easier to develop individualized treatment plans. The researchers believe that this will allow for improved health care while reducing costs.

[b][color=white]Questionable Behavior by Luis Suarez[/color][/b]
As the World Cup continues to go on in Brazil, there have been very exciting games where fans were up on their feet cheering and cheering for their favorite team and where fans were caught in shock and awe. A notable game was definitely the most recent: Uruguay vs. Italy. This match definitely sparked some interest. Nine to ten minutes before the match ended, Uruguay's forward, Luis Suarez, bit Italy's defender, Giorgio Chiellini, on the shoulder. A replay of the event shows Suarez grabbing his teeth while Chiellini lays on the pitch in pain. Surprisingly enough, the referees did not send Suarez off the pitch for his actions. Suarez and Chiellini were both inside the penalty area and were close enough to each other for Suarez to take a bite. Afterwards, both of them fell to the ground. While this was happening, Chiellini clenched onto his shoulder as he was in pain. Suarez's motive was most likely to stop Italy from getting the ball and helping Uruguay to score a goal. Suarez, the man caught red handed, was seen holding his teeth indicating that he actually bit him. This is not the first time that Suarez has bitten a player. He has bitten PSV Eindhoven's Otman Bakkal and Chelsea's Branislov Ivanovic. This action could possibly get the team suspended from the World Cup or even getting Suarez banned from playing the next match. Chiellini tried his best to show the referee the bite marks and the damage done, but Rodriguez (referee) decided not to pull out the yellow or red card. Chiellini was reported to have said, "He bit me, he bit me!" There was a clip of the match where you could see Chiellini running to the ref showing the marks, but instead, Rodriquez kept the foul cards in his pockets and told everyone to continue the match. Uruguay eventually won this game against Italy 1-0, when Diego Godín (Uruguay) scored a header at the 81' minute. [b][color=white]Old Maiden Statues from Ancient Greece Refurbished[/color][/b]
Using recent laser technology, the process of restoring these statues has been completed after four years by a team of only six (five conservators and a laser technician). The reason for such a long process comes from the accuracy needed from the lasers to remove the grime that has built up over the decades of an industrializing Greece. Acid rain and air pollution are the main culprits. The laser cleans only about a square millimeter of each statue at a time and such must be carefully monitored. Some areas were considered especially harder than others based on the thickness of the grime and required more care. The care shown to these statues displays the respect that modern people still have for their ancient culture. The statues can currently be see and appreciated in the Acropolis Museum located in Athens, Greece.

[b][color=white]A Brief Explanation of Friday the 13th[/color][/b]
This year, Friday the 13th landed in June with a full moon and some people will inevitably question such an odd "holiday." The origins of Friday the 13th can only be found in western culture and have been amplified by a certain movie featuring Jason Voorhees. The most-likely reason for the embracement of this superficial holiday by westerners may come from Judas (a betrayer of Jesus) being the 13th guest at the last supper followed by Jesus being then crucified on a Friday. The combination of these two coincidences gives us Friday the 13th. This day, however, can not considered "all bad." People tend to act safer in the threat of perceived danger as it has been studied and therefore this special Friday can lead to a more cautious population. Keep that in mind and hopefully no masked murderer will come for you in the night.

[b][color=white]25th Anniversary of the Rebellion in Tiananmen Square[/color][/b]
On the night of June 3rd, 1989, the sounds of gunfire could be heard at Tiananmen Square. During the previous days before this night, one could see thousands of protesters (many being students) across the area calling for less corruption and a more pro-democratic government. The exact number of deaths from this evening still has yet to be released by the Chinese government and even attempting to gain footage of the square is nearly impossible. Not all is lost however; President Xi Jinping has promised reforms against corruption of the communist party and claims the corruption itself to be the party's biggest enemy. He has already begun cracking down on officials taking advantage of their positions of power and the judicial system itself.

[b][color=white]United States President Barack Obama Visits Native American Country[/color][/b]
President Obama took a visit to the Standing Rock Lakota reservation in Cannon Ball, North Dakota on the day of June 13, 2014. During his visit, the president addressed the problems surrounding the experience of Native Americans in the United States as well as taking part in some of the Native American's Flag Day celebratory practices. This visit was president Obama's first since taking office in 2009 as well as the first presidential visit to a Native American reservation since Bill Clinton's visit to the Pine Ridge reservation in South Dakota in 1999. Obama took a visit to the Crow reservation in Montana before his becoming president. Also during his visit, Obama and his wife Michelle took the time to meet with twenty students. One of the students described their experience as a "powerful" one and felt as though they were inspired to be themselves.

[b][color=white]Guatemalan Communities Organize Protests and Roadblocks on a National Level[/b][/color]
On the day of June 24, 2014, indigenous people and groups from all throughout Guatemala took part in national protests and roadblocks to shed light on the continued injustice and discrimination faced by the indigenous peoples of Guatemala. Among the main priorities on the list of causes for protest were the discriminatory telecommunication laws as well as the mining and hydroelectric companies exploiting indigenous territories. The march in Xela began at eight in the morning from three different entry points into the center of the city. The three groups would all meet for a much larger demonstration in the Central Park of the city later that morning. Hundreds upon hundreds of indigenous people participated in the protests and roadblocks. It was clear that they have had enough.

[b][color=white]Nelson Mandela Leaves Behind Estate of $4.1 Million to Family and Acquaintances[/b][/color]
South African anti-apartheid hero and winner of the Nobel Peace Prize in 1993, Nelson Mandela, left around 46 million rand, which is around $4.1 million in U.S. money, in assets to the members of his family, former staff, many schools, and the ruling party of South Africa, according to his will executors. The former South African president's will had not been contested so far that Mandela's third wife, Graca Machel, may dismiss her claims to the estate. Nelson Mandela died on December 5, 2013 at the age of 95. He lived a long and certainly successful life. His funeral ceremony was held in Qunu, South Africa on December 15, 2013 and was attended by thousands upon thousands of people.

The new film is said to feature a witch as a leading lady with ghosts figuring prominently into the narrative alongside rumored returns of past stars from the series. Among those rumored to be apart of the cast, mainstays Johnny Depp and Geoffery Rush have been confirmed to return to their roles as Jack Sparrow and Captain Barbosa respectively. The film is like to debut in the summer of the 2016, where it will have to share space with Batman V. Superman: Dawn Of Justice, Independence Day 2, and Finding Dory.

[color=white][b]Transformers: Age Of Extinction LAwsuit Demands Immediate Edits to Michael Bay's Film[/b][/color]
With Transformers: Age Of Extinction set to open on Friday, it would seem that nothing would stop the movie from piling up the box office records again until a property developer from Beijing came along and changed that all. Beijing Pangu Investment Co. Ltd is suing its business partners and demanding that Paramount Pictures edit Transformers: Age Of Extinction before it plays in China. The company owns a dragon-shaped hotel called Pangu Plaza and their complaint alleges that some of their properties and logos are on display in the latest Transformers movie. Beijing Pangu Investment Co. Ltd is also imploring the Chinese government to stall the theatrical release of the movie in China until it's revised to edit out all of the logos and properties belonging to this allegedly wronged developer. In a statement regarding the lawsuit that is aimed at the company's Chinese partners, Beijing Pangu Investment Co. Ltd explains: "The loss of rights and interests not only caused the Pangu company’s original business plan to fail, incurring huge losses, more seriously, it has affected Pangu Plaza’s image and reputation." Transformers: Age Of Extinction opens in the U.S. and China on June 27th.

[color=white][b]Iron Man 3's Shane Black Set to Direct Predator Reboot[/b][/color]
Shane Black is best known in Hollywood for his skill behind the scenes, having scripted action classics like Lethal Weapon, The Last Boy Scout, The Long Kiss Good Night, and most recently, Iron Man 3. What few do not know is that he also has a bit of acting skill as well. One of his earliest roles was as the bespectacled Hawkins in Predator, a film series that he is set to direct as a reboot of the earlier classics. Sources have confirmed that Black has signed a deal with Twentieth Century Fox that will see the filmmaker take the helm of a brand new Predator reboot as both writer and director. Details about the project remain unclear, but trade reports suggests that the film could be planned as a relaunch of the 80's franchise.

[b][color=white]Michael Bay - The Last Ship[/color][/b]
The crew of a naval ship are forced to confront a new pandemic that kills off most of the earth's population. Since Michael Bay is directing this series you can expect the big explosions and combat within the first minutes of the new series. After the first episode, fans were quick to respond. [i]"The Last Ship"[/i] has mainly received positive feedback and scored a 7.4 out of 10. [i]"The Last Ship"[/i] currently airs Sundays on TNT at 9PM EST. [i]"The Lat Ship"[/i] is currently on season one and has only aired one episode. [i]"The Last Ship"[/i] was cable's top debut so far this year. The show is definetly worth a watch and will be interesting to see what comes of the new television show.

[b][color=white]Dominion on Syfy [/color][/b]
[i]"Dominion"[/i] follows the journey of a young soldier who discovers he's the "Chosen One" and is now the savior of humanity. If you are into angels and religion, then this is a television series for you to watch. [i]"Dominion"[/i] runs a lengthy time of 90 minutes. IMDb scored this new series a 7.7 out of 10. The show is currently airing Thursday's at 9PM EST and is currently in season one and episode one has already aired. Stars of the show include a few know actors and actresses such as Christopher Egan, Tom Wisdom, and Roxanne McKee.

[b][color=white]Tyrant on FX [/color][/b]
[i]"Tyrant"[/i] premiered this Wednesday night and has a run time of 60 minutes. The show has scored a astonishing 8.6 out of 10 and the reviews keep getting better. The show is a story of an American family drawn into the family workings of a Middle Eastern nation and regardless of its flaws, it is worth the watch given its constant improvement. [i]"Tyrant"[/i] was created by Gideon Raff, the man that inspired [i]"Homeland"[/i], in order to open the minds of individuals and is meant to be a complex political drama from recent headlines.

"Why do you read the HF News?"

[i]"I read the HF News for a verity of reasons, like science and 
tech news majorly, and sometimes even gaming news although 
I'm not a gamer myself. Ha! I will miss the Minecraft news, as 
that was the way I found out about Minecraft in the first place, 
and I followed the snapshots and updates ever since by reading 
that section. I've also followed tech news, reading what's new and 
what's being invented. The security tip of the week and so on. 
They always inspire me to research a bit more ability whatever 
interests me more! Same thing with the science section, I always 
love to check out the new things in the science community. 
Science has always been a big thing for me and thats's why it's 
one of my favorite sections. I guess I also like the general user 
news and headlines. That way, we know whats's up in the forum. 
There are a lot of great threads mentioned, some funny and 
others no quite so much, but they are entertaining. You can 
always learn something new!"[/i]
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1376915][i]-Sweeth Belle McCartney[/i][/url]

[align=right][i]"The HF news is an easy way to catch up with what's been 
happening on HF and out and around too, if you miss anything, 
group news, user news, headlines stuff, further to gaming news, 
business news etc. HF news is an easy place to catch up with the 
week's events, making it convenient to see what's been going on 
in one place."[/i]
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1205532][i]-Robust[/i][/url][/align]

[i]"Just like anyone else, I read the news to get caught up on hack

reading about peoples achievements. I love reading peoples opinions 
on topics which Sir provides to us each week. There are many factors 
which lead up to me getting excited over the news here on hackforums. 
I could tell you more, but I don't really need to go in depth."[/i]
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1884994][i]-Sample Text[/i][/url]
